title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. Write the given expression:
(32x²y - 16xy²) / $$(-8xy)$$.

$$2$$. Split the polynomial over the monomial to divide each term separately:
$$=$$ (32x²y / -8xy) + $$[(-16xy²)$$ / -8xy].

$$3$$. Simplify each fraction:
• 32x²y / -8xy $$=$$ (32 / -8) × (x² / x) × (y / y) $$=$$ $$-4x$$.
• $$(-16xy²)$$ / -8xy $$=$$ (-16 / -8) × (x / x) × (y² / y) $$=$$ $$2y$$.

$$4$$. Combine the simplified results:
$$-4x$$ + $$2y$$.
...
